item.title: Notes on Mathematics - Optimization
item.description: Lagrange Method Kuhn-Tucker Method Dual Problem Lagrange Method PS11.Q1 Solve \(\max_{(x,y)\in \mathbb{R}^2} x+y\) s.t. \(x^2+y^2=2\) Lagrangian: \[\mathcal{L}(x,y,λ) = x+y+λ(x^2+y^2-2)\] FOC \[\begin{aligned} \frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial x} = 1 + 2λx = 0 && x &= -\frac{1}{2λ} \\ \frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial y} = 1 + 2λy = 0 && y &= -\frac{1}{2λ} \\ x^2+y^2=2 && \frac{1}{4λ^2} &= 1 \implies λ = \pm \frac{1}{2}\end{aligned}\] 1. When \(λ = \frac{1}{2}\) \[\begin{aligned} x &= -1 \\ y &= -1 \\ x+y &= -2\end{aligned}\] 2.
